newsitem.title: USA: Brooklyn Union buys into N. Irish natural.
newsitem.headline: Brooklyn Union buys into N. Irish natural.

text.p: Brooklyn Union Gas Co. said Tuesday it will acquire a 24.5 percent stake in two subsidiaries of Britain's BG Plc that are developing a natural gas market in Northern Ireland.

Brooklyn Union subsidiary KeySpan International Ltd. will acquire the stake in Phoenix Natural Gas Ltd. and Premier Transco Ltd., said a joint statement from Brooklyn Union and BG Plc, formerly British Gas Plc.

Phoenix Natural Gas, which has already announced plans for a 160-million-pound ($261.2 million) investent in Northern Ireland, was awarded a license to develop a natural gas industry in the British province last year.
Supplies to its first industrial customber began last December. It will also supply domestic customers.
Premier Transco built and operates a pipeline linking Northern Ireland and Scotland.
Details of the acquisition costs were not disclosed.
"We are delighted that a company of Brooklyn Union's international stature is joining us in the development of Northern Ireland's natural gas industry," said David Varney, chief executive of BG Plc.
Brooklyn Union Chairman Robert Catell said the joint venture fit perfectly with his company's long-term investment plans.

"We believe natural gas will be the fuel of the future for Northern Ireland," said Catell, whose company also plans to merge with Long Island Lighting Co. to form a $4 billion electric and gas utility.
Tuesday's announcement was made at a news conference in Belfast attended by senior officials from both companies.
A BG Plc spokesman declined to say how much the acquisition cost. "We are not able to go into details of the financial arrangements," he said.
"There is a possibility of further discussions with other potential joint venture partners. Clearly, we would not wish to compromise our negotiating position."
